name: Esquites (Mexican Elotes Salad)
author: CJ
summary: Elote, made from grilled corn on the cob and slathered in deliciousness, is a popular street food that shows up at the local fair every year. Esquites are an off-the-cob version that makes a refreshing salad on a hot summer day. Top with more Cotija cheese and a dusting of Tajin®.
ingredients: 4 ears corn, kernels cut from cob
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon mayonnaise, or more to taste
1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or more to taste
directions: Heat oil in a large cast iron skillet over high heat until shimmering
Add corn kernels, in batches if necessary
Stir briefly; sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper
Cook, without stirring, until corn is slightly charred, about 2 minutes
Stir once and cook for 1 minute more
Remove from heat and set aside
Mix shallot, mayonnaise, and chile-lime seasoning together in a large bowl
Stir in the corn and jalapeno until well coated in dressing
Stir in 1/2 of the cilantro and Cotija cheese
Serve each portion with a lime wedge
